Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine S
Reviews.Content: What do you expect from a 2-star hotel? It was clean, staff was friendly and the breakfast, though minimal, was fresh. You can't beat the price if you're not looking for fancy. Yes, the bathroom is tiny but it serves its purpose. The pool was clean and not too cold. Didn't get to view the hottub as it was full during our stay. Had no trouble getting extra towels when requested. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Terry K
Reviews.Content: Starting off I want to say: I booked this hotel through priceline.com for the indoor heated pool, hot tub, and gym. It was a routine weekend stay in Indianapolis for me from a Friday night to a Sunday morning. I was not made aware that the gym closed at 10pm leaving me only 20 minutes (at best) to do anything before the deadline. The pool towels are held hostage at the front desk so be sure to grab some before jumping in otherwise you will be soaked and freezing through the unheated glass encased breezeway that connects the poolroom to the hotel. I never got to enjoy the pool or hot tub anyway since the hotel was so insanely over crowded compared to the facilities available. The free breakfast is non-existent unless you get out there on the double, by 9:20am everything is gone (save a lone brand muffin) and the cleanup crew is working diligently. The main hallway stinks of mildew and the carpet visibly needs replaced. On the day of checkout (9:30am) the maid knocked twice very quickly and was halfway in my room through the locked door before I yelled 'hello' and she retreated apologetically.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms is always a plus!”
Reviews.Author: TexShel
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay. The hotel was bundled in a pakage with flight and car. The rooms were clean and the walkways (halls) were clean. My only problem was the vending machines were all non-working.

Reviews.Title: “I honestly can't think of why anyone would stay here.”
Reviews.Author: dedfar
Reviews.Content: So I usually don't post negative reviews and I'll try to keep this factual, but this stay was so bad I felt compelled to post. A couple of notes. We were here over superbowl weekend. So we paid way too much for this room (although I can't think of a price I could pay that would make me feel good about the stay), and the hotel was sold out. Some of this might not apply as much if there were fewer people in the hotel. Clean: The sheets and towels seemed clean enough, but the rest of the place was pretty gross. The blanket on the bed was really beat up, and there was a chair in our room that looked like it came from someone's dorm room. I'm not exaggerating. I added a photo of it which if you zoom in you can see it. The black mark at the top is ground-in dirt from people's heads. The arms and seat were stained with ground-in dirt and other unidentified things. Pretty disgusting. Staff: Really friendly and helpful. To be fair, everyone in Indiana seems this way. It was a really nice surprise to find so many friendly people around you the entire trip. I would imagine most hotels in this area would have friendly, helpful people so while this was a plus, I'm not sure it would be unique. Facility: Pretty run down in general. Dingy was the word that kept coming to mind. It has a pool which seemed unique for hotels in this area. We didn't use it. Location: It is located in the north-northwest corner of the indy circle. It was an easy drive into the city (25 minutes on highway), but if it wasn't superbowl w/e you can stay in the city if you like. Noise: Unbearable. Let's start inside the room. The refrigerator goes on and off about a dozen times in the night. When it starts up, it sounds like a car starting. Same with the heat or A/C. Once they are going they are just a very loud hum, but the on/off is pretty loud and they are not synchronized so you will have to deal with this from one of them about 20 times an night Outside the room. In a hotel there is always the occasional noise from the hallway or the slamming of a door, but this hotel in particular seems to have the thinnest walls/doors I have ever encountered. Every noise makes it into the room. We had to call the front desk all three nights because our neighbor liked to fall asleep with the TV on. It doesn't have to be loud because once things settle down, we could still hear him breathing in his sleep. We were also awoken one morning to our other neighbor in his bathroom. It sounded like there was just a curtain between us. I won't get into details, but it was a really awful. Again, if you stayed here normally maybe you wouldn't have neighbors and would just have to deal with the inside noises and housekeeping. The housekeeping folks come down the hall talking as loud as they can around 8am. They do this for about 15 minutes before they start cleaning the rooms. They will also ignore your do not disturb sign and knock on the door around 8:30-8:45 and if you don't answer, try to come in. We heard many other people yelling at them to get out. In the end, you start to look forward to the refrigerator and heating noise to drown out all of the other stuff. The problem is they go off so then you hear it all again, as well as the loud noises when they start up. Oh, and we also ran out of hot water on Sunday so there were no showers. Again, it was sold out so some of this might not apply on normal days, but why take the chance. We travel a lot and stay in everything from motels in the sticks to 5-star places. I like to think we are pretty open minded and appreciate the context we are in, but with all of the choices for hotels in this area I can't think of a single reason you would want to take the chance on staying here. There has to be a dozen better choices you could pick. This hotel needs a major upgrade to fix the dirty and noise issues. It doesn't seem like they have put any real money into this hotel for a decade.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: Found this on hotwire and got a good deal. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. There are a ton of restaurants in the area which is good. If you are looking for something safe, clean and a good value...I would reccomend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough given the price!”
Reviews.Author: S8epilot
Reviews.Content: Got a killer deal on this hotel. Clean and plenty good for a place to crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wealwaysbtraveling
Reviews.Content: The room was a little musty smelling where it had been closed up without the air running. It just needs a little updating. We needed a room for a softball tournament and group of us ended up staying here. The price wasn't bad. The free breakfast was descent. Did not get a chance to check out the pool area but was told that it was nice. The attendant, Marcia, was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and unsanitary!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kk1154
Reviews.Content: I was involed in a automobile accident with severe back issues.One of the reasons we picked this hotel was because of the spa and heated pool for my back. The was ice cold and indoors and the spa was filthy with brown foam on the top complained to front desk she called the owner he came down and said he changex water. The water was dirty and hottub had dirt in the bottom of it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very kind, good value.”
Reviews.Author: howard w
Reviews.Content: My son and I had several rooms for his Wedding Groomsmen. We needed to take 8 showers and get into tuxes 45 Min. The Staff generously provided us w a conference room for dressing. The rooms themselves were a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very average at best”
Reviews.Author: Jeremym1235
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit run down. Breakfast was ok but the eating area was a bit messy. Room was ok but not great. Over all, a very average to below average stay. We stayed for a soccer tournament and they seemed a bit unprepared and overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: iammrphil
Reviews.Content: I have never had a complaint about a hotel before. This hotel had a rude lady working the front desk. When we arrived at 3:30pm we were told by her well let me see if we have a room ready. I said I hope so it is after 3:00 which is check in time. She said well listen we were busy today and I will see if I can give you a room. I said we have reservations. She said that does not mean we have a room ready for you so just hush and wait. Unreal! Tell me to hush. After a few minutes she said well you are in luck I have one ready. We got to the room and the room was very dirty. 2 towels and no washcloth or soap. We went to the desk to get them. Then the TV did not work right. It was fussy and could not watch it. I called the desk and the same lady said why don't you check the cable connections on it we are too busy. I said I am not a TV tech and please give us another room with a working TV. She said you are lucky you got a room. I said I will check out then. She said wait a guy will check it. About a hour later a man came and he fixed it. We then left to dinner. When returning the hotel there was about 20 motorcycles parked in the underneath of the front enterance. There were about 10 bikers standing outside the door smoking and drinking beer. I was afraid to get out of the car. My husband said lets stick together and go in. Inside the front lobby was a big party of bikers drinking and yelling and talking loud and blocking the way into the lobby area. It was very frightful. We made it to our room and I called to complain at the front desk and was told so what they are guest too and your in your room now so don't worry. We tried sleeping but could not straight through because of all the noise in the hall from the people screaming and yelling like it was a big party out there. I am so upset and talked to the lady in the morning when checking out and was told nothing she could do about it. So this is why I am writing to be compensated for the nightmare at the hotel. Please call my husband or write me back and hope to get this settled. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families with children”
Reviews.Author: datura27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn for just one night while visiting the Children's Museum. We were on a tight budget for this trip, so I was a little concerned about the caliber of hotels we would find in our price range - particularly because we were traveling with our three children (ages 6 and under). I chose this hotel because of the good reviews it seemed to get, despite the price range. I was very pleased with the quality we found here! The hotel is in a shopping area with several dining options nearby. The staff was very friendly. The hotel could use some updating in terms of carpeting and general decor, but the room itself was nicely furnished and a good size. The pool area was very clean. The free breakfast they offer is much more than your typical dry cereal and coffee - they offer a variety, including Belgian waffles, fruit, pastries, etc. For the price we paid for this hotel, I expected much, much less. It certainly doesn't offer scenic views or deluxe amenities. But if you're looking for a place to stop for the night that's clean, safe and acceptable for sleeping at a low price, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: qwedsazxc
Reviews.Content: First floor very dirty especially dirty, carpets smelled very bad. Pool water not clean. Housekeeping failed to clean room within five hours. Breakfeast area not well maintained. Treated very poorly by front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Literally went Wow for Cheap Dollars”
Reviews.Author: Flynboat
Reviews.Content: "King Valued Room" with AAA discount & tax under $50 with BIG room, couch, nice big table for laptop & papers, decent BIG tub-shower & tiled bath, wet-bar w cooler (that worked), and KING bed that slept great just off the interstate connections; sure it was 3-4 miles down 86th from the $189 high priced stuff near Keystone Crossings, but hey, got great food, dining, and snacks with money saved. Yes, the ceiling needed painting, but was not spending $25/hr to sleep either! Good value if "regular" people.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tenneseedad1
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this days inn as i was traveling through indy on my way to colorado. I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews. When i arrived late there was a gentelman working the desk I think his name was Robert greeted me with a big smile and a friendly welcome. He explained what the hotel had to offer and the hours. He even helped me with the best directions to get to colorado a she was from there a few years ago. They helped me out a great deal. the carpet in the halls are a little old as stated in other reviews but not as dirty as the other people said. the room was very clean and the first thing i check is the bed and turnes out it was very clean. the bathroom was a little small but very clean also. My overall experience aat this hotel was fantastic and i will be staying here on my wat back home. I find it hard to believe that so many people complain about his hotel and you can not beat the price. a clean room, hot shower, pool and friendly staff for under 50 bucks. if you need a place in a safe area away from the downtown mess then this place is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynn1991
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed here a total of three times and have truly enjoyed our stay each and every time. We had stayed here for a week in March, July, and October of 2009 and were welcomed with a friendly staff and clean rooms. The pool was great, a little dirty, but well worth it. If you're looking for a cheap, good quality hotel not far from Indy's main attractions- this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ferrari458
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!! We stayed at this hotel because our friends who lived in Indianapolis told us that we should stay on the north side of town if we wanted to be in the nice and safe areas of Indy. I had already made my reservation before reading these negative reviews...Turns out that this was a very nice hotel! We didn't have any problems at all with our stay. The best thing other than having an awesome indoor pool was the customer service!! They've got some really nice people working there. We've stayed at a lot of hotels and most of them treat you like cattle, just like what the airlines do, but these guys treat us like Human Beings! It's real relief to be staying at a place where that place doesn't cause more stress and frustration that you need, especially being with your family! I get enough stress at work, I don't need more when I'm on vacation! Overall great place to stay! And for the price it was an awesome value!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beach Pal
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel later on a Saturday afternoon. the lobby was clean, then we started walking down the hallway to our room, the floors were dirty, not vaccuumed in a very long time, then we opened the door to our room, that was horrible!!!! The smell hit you in the face as you walked into the room. I immediately got out my laptop, and found us another hotel in the area, and checked out promptly. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, I wouldn't even let my dogs sleep there, I think too much of them also.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kmariemc7
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but something needs to be said about this situation. We stayed in this hotel mainly because it advertised an indoor pool, and hot tub. We called in advance and inquired about the facilities. They assured us the pool and hot tub was in excellent condition and we would have a wonderful stay. The pool had no heat. It was not just a little cold, it was freezing. The hot tub had large black scum bubbles on top of it, and a greasy black film line around the sides. I have never seen anything like it before. It was deplorable, and foul. We took our children back to the room to "swim" in the tub, and found it had black fungus growing around the calk line, and inside the clear faucet handle. We spoke to the person in charge about the pool. (manager was not on site). She did not seem concerned. She said, their must have been dirty people in it last night, and it has not been cleaned yet. I asked about the heat in the pool. She said the heat is turned off completely in the whole pool wing in the evening, and turned it on again when the pool opened in the morning, 9:00 am. She said it can take many hours for the pool to get warm during the day. We requested our money back, and she said the pool and the hot tub are separate amenities from the room, and not included in the price of the room. The most she said she could do was give us $10.00 off of our room. We asked to speak to the manager, she said he was not there, and she did not have his number. I mentioned that I did not understand why the health department had not closed the place down, and then she suddenly said, Oh, I think maybe I do know where the number is. She called her manager and talked about me for a while, then offered me 50% off my room. We lost our limited vacation time with our children. I do not want to see someone else go through this. Find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expereince”
Reviews.Author: thinkin'vacation
Reviews.Content: I blocked rooms at this location for a wedding this past weekend. Due to an event weekend in Indy, prices were very high, even here. But facilities were very nice & staff was exceptionally nice (NEW OWNERS). Carpet & room furnishings were new. (Hall carpet stained, tho.) I've stayed in a few Days Inns before, but not by choice & usually pretty poor standards... but this place was a pleasant surprise. VERY CLEAN NICE ROOMS! Linens usual poor quality of budget hotel, but everything else ABOVE average. Very nice complimentary continental brfst. Staff was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Was ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ariadnae
Reviews.Content: This hotel was "ok". We paid $59/ per night, so I guess you get what you pay for. It was clean and the lobby is nice. Staff was hit or miss, some were really helpful, others not so much. Our room was nice, there was a fridge and microwave, which was great. The pool is nice, but really chlorinated. The hot tub didn't always work. There were a bunch of bratty soccer team kids there who acted really poorly in the pool area, but what can you do? The continetal breakfast was AWFUL. Poor choices, bad food, dirty tables etc. Our friends who stayed with us had ants int heir room and their bed had a very noticeable dip in the middle, which the hotel wouldn't fix, or lied about fixing for 3 days. Location was good, lot's to do in the area. All in all, about a 2.5 out of 5 stars.
